title.rendered: Bridgepoint and Bonnier divest Nordic Cinema Group to AMC Entertainment

content.rendered:
Bridgepoint and Bonnier have agreed to divest Nordic Cinema Group (NCG) to AMC Entertainment at a value of some SEK 8.250 billion. The transaction is subject to regulatory approval and is expected to close during the spring of 2017.

NCG was formed in May 2013 through the merger between SF Bio Group and the Finnkino Group. The owners at that time, Ratos and Bonnier, divested NCG in 2015 to Bridgepoint, with Bonnier as continued co-owner. NCG is the leading cinema operator in the Nordic and Baltic regions with 68 wholly-owned cinemas comprising of 463 screens and other 50 partly-owned cinemas. NCG has an annual turnover exceeding SEK 3 billion and is owned by Bridgepoint (68%), Bonnier (30%) and management.

Mannheimer Swartling assisted Bridgepoint and Bonnier in the transaction, alongside White & Case (London). Dittmar & Indrenius, BA-HR, COBALT, Valiunas Ellex, Klavins Ellex and Gorrissen Federspiel acted as local counsel.
